result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jesse J. Everson was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: **On December 7, 2017 the court held a hearing and amended the revocation period to 24 months**

miscConds.notes: Cash Bond previouisly posted in the amount of $2000.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of $200.00 is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the Fine.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Credit for 1 day of prior time served.  Sentence to commence forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:37 pm case called. Defendant Jesse J. Everson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over post judgment motion filed by the defendant regarding license revocation. Court questions DA Anderson. Statement by DA Anderson-no objection to relief being granted based upon information provided by defendant prior to court. Court amends the JOC and impose a 24 month period of revocation with credit for the time imposed from the 2/13/2015 conviction date.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 11:56 AM: Defendant Jesse J. Everson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by DA. Jt recommendation for sentencing.   Def and counsel concur w/recital.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Meds serving no impairment on proceeding.   Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Agrees w/4 prior convictions as recited by Court.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea (OWI 5):  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 dismissed outright.  14TR002222 and 14TR002223.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution - 4 yr or 48 mos bifurcated SEH - 18 mos IC/30 mos ES - I/S - S/W - 36 mos probation.  Conditions:  7 mos WCJ - Huber, GT and 1 day TS credit - Sentence to commence forthwith immediately following sentencing; Complete AODA and any follow thru as recommended; Ab Sobriety; Bar Prohibition; No possession of any impairing substances unless prescribed by a physician; Successfully complete the Waushara Co TAD program; $2200 fine that includes DNA and all other costs including $42.50 blood draw fee; 60 DTP or PP.  In the event of Revocation Def would be Eligible for CIP/SAP.   36 mos DL Rev/IID.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 13, 2015 at 11:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Jesse J. Everson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Peebles requesting a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 11:45 am.

Case Called @ 1:00 PM: Defendant Jesse J. Everson in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Def stands mute to charges.  NGP entered by Court.  Court notes possible TAD Court referral.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for December 30, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Initial appearance on December 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:07 PM:  Defendant Jesse J. Everson in court, in custody, appearing via video.   ADA Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def admits receipt of Complaint.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def did speak with SPD on eligibility, did not qualify for SPD services.  Def intends to hire own counsel.  ADA argues as to bond - $2000 cash bond requested.  Def does not make statement as to bond request.  The Court accepts all of the State's recommendation as to bond and orders same as requested.  Def to obtain counsel prior to IA - IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
